intro: Psoralidium lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate psoralidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its presence in these habitats makes it an important component of the local flora.
